item.title: What's more stable?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Squirt Ltd, post:11, topic:390171”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=486082.msg3562406#msg3562406 date=1302381235]

i don’t think theres alot of difference but hyperion is beast

There is a massive difference between both servers…
[/quote]

i ment stability wise…[/quote]

Still a massive difference stability wise.

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:10, topic:390171”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=486082.msg3562539#msg3562539 date=1302388886]
Three: Hyperion is totally scratch, as for SHARD it was based on a WinterLove server…
[/quote]

Scratch that. Hyperion looked at other servers problems. So it was influenced.[/quote]

Hyperion is still a scratch server, it uses no other servers code…

Read full topic

item.title: What's more stable?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:7, topic:390171”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=486082.msg3562408#msg3562408 date=1302381470]
^ So what’s the difference? There’s never an explanation lol.
[/quote]

One: Hyperion is far superior with net working.
Two: Hyperion is far superior with Player Updating.
Three: Hyperion is totally scratch, as for SHARD it was based on a WinterLove server…
Four: Hyperion has many other features that SHARD could wish to have.
Five: They are both way different in programming styles…
Six: ect, ect, ect.[/quote]
Seven: you have to add 999999999 packets to Hyperion.

OP:
Hyperion is far more superior, than Shards will ever be. The only unfortunate thing for newbie programmers is, Hyperion is far more complex in programming style than your regular PI/Delta server. And it takes some getting use to, but it gets easier and easier the more you use it.

Read full topic

item.title: What's more stable?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I hosted Hyperion on 512MB RAM laptop on a 56k dial-up mobile phone internet connection and my CPU was the same as running nothing at all and we experienced no lag. Shards is still stable enough though, go for what you prefer out of the two.

Read full topic
